comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: A room in the Palácio das Necessidades in Lisbon. "On 5 October 1910, during the Republican Revolution, the palace, because it was the official residence of the king, Manuel II, was shelled by the cruiser Adamastor, one of the ships stationed in the Tagus River. The salvoes caused some damage to the Palace, and one of the bomblets even reached the king's private quarters on the first floor, but he had taken refuge elsewhere on the palace grounds." (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palace_of_Necessidades) A similar photo is in Los Angeles herald [microform]., November 20, 1910, Image 49
